</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the combat mode of the given AI [[Group | group]]. See [[setCombatMode]] for more information about combat modes. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[combatMode]] group</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> group: [[Group]] or [[Object]]. If the argument is unit [[Object]], unit's current group is used. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] -  
One of "BLUE", "GREEN", "WHITE", "YELLOW" and "RED" or "ERROR" </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[combatMode]] _grp1 == "BLUE") [[then]] {_grp1 [[setCombatMode]] "GREEN"};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Combat Modes]], [[setCombatMode]], [[behaviour]], [[setBehaviour]], [[skill]], [[setSkill]], [[Arma 3 AI Skill]], [[setUnitCombatMode]], [[unitCombatMode]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 3, 2006 - 14:25
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''

Use [[setCombatMode]] to set the combat mode. The definitions of the colours are given under that command.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', combatMode return value does not change when unit's combat mode is set with radio commands, ie troops under the player's command.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
